decision_conditions:
Reason : 1 - The proposed development by reason of its siting, size, design and materials represents an incongruous, unneighbourly, visually intrusive and overly dominant form of development that would harm the amenity of neighbouring residents and would fail to respect the appearance, materials, scale, bulk, proportions and character of the original building and its surroundings thereby failing to complement and enhance the character of the wider setting. The proposals are therefore considered contrary to policies D3 of the London Plan 2021, policies CS9 & CS 14 of the Merton Core Strategy 2011 and policy DM D2 of the Adopted Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Reason : 2 - The proposed development by reason of its siting, design, materials and layout would result in the provision of poor quality, unattractive, cramped and unsatisfactory accommodation failing to meet nationally prescribed minimum internal floorspace standards to the detriment of the amenities of future occupiers, would fail to provide adequate and good quality usable private amenity spaces, and given the proximity of the habitable room windows to the adjacent accessways would result in unacceptable issues of privacy and outlook to the detriment of future occupier amenity. The proposals would be contrary to policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan 2021, policies CS9 & CS 14 of the Merton Core Strategy 2011 and policy DM D2 of the Adopted Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014.


Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was considered to be fundamentally contrary to the provisions of the Development Plan and the NPPF, and there were not considered to be any solutions to resolve this conflict. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
description: DEMOLITION OF THE EXISTING DETACHED STORAGE BUILDING  AND ERECTION OF A TWO STOREY BUILDING TO PROVIDE 4 X SELF CONTAINED FLATS
